meanings.sent1: The ground began to quake as the giant monster stomped closer.
meanings.sent2: I felt the building quake during the earthquake.
meanings.sent3: The little dog made the whole house quake with his enthusiastic tail wagging.
meanings.sent4: Her voice quaked with emotion as she delivered the heartfelt speech.
meanings.sent5: The thunderous applause made the entire stadium quake with excitement.

meanings.sent1: The quake of the train passing by could be felt throughout the platform.
meanings.sent2: The quake of the volcano eruption was felt miles away.
meanings.sent3: The quake of the dancer's feet on the stage added to the rhythm of the music.
meanings.sent4: The quake of the avalanche echoed through the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The quake of the thunderstorm rattled the windows of the old house.

meanings.definition: (adjective) shaking or trembling in fear or excitement
meanings.sent1: Her quake hands betrayed her nervousness during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: The quake child clung to his mother during the loud thunderstorm.
meanings.sent3: The quake puppy's tail wagged uncontrollably when he saw his favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: His quake voice revealed his excitement for the upcoming adventure.
meanings.sent5: The quake crowd eagerly awaited the start of the concert.
